page.title: 10Rag Week, Lancaster
page.content: Rag Week is held at Lancaster Univeristy every year in November. Its main purpose is to raise money for charity and for students and residents to have fun. Events include sponsored walks and wheelchair races from Morecambe to Lancaster; hit squads who jump off Morcambe Pier, 3 legged and wheelbarrow races, pub crawlsand record breaking attempts. The week ends with a procession of colourful floats through the streets of Lancaster, with students persuading the local residents to part with their money. The money raised, about Â£5000 a year, goes to at least 15 different chariuties in the local area. A committee of students plan out the events each year, organise a rag ball and sell T shirts and posters.
